>So said Ilja Preuss on 4/9/2003 --------------------
>> > Actually, I find that I'm spending even *larger* amounts of time
>> working 
>> > with my tests.  I haven't measured, but I'd have to guess around
>> 70%.
>> 
>> If testing time is so high, then who wants to blame me for looking 
>> for Parasoft JTest to make testing more productive?
>> 
>> I know you don't blame me, but others did.
>
>I don't remember someone blaming you for *wanting to try* Jtest. What I
>remember is *you* blaming *us* for using Junit and making unsustainable
>claims about the effectiveness of Junit vs. DBC (without even having
>tried one of them). (My memory might be somewhat distorted, of course.)

That's accurate.

>> And you understand that DbC is not such a bad idea as some people 
>> here believe.
>
>I also don't remember anyone claiming that DBC is a bad idea. What I
>remember is *you* claiming that DBC could replace Junit (which simply is
>wrong).

Let's stop feeding the troll. :)
